A live performance of Hit Me With Your Best Shot by Pat Benatar and Martina McBride from the show CMT Crossroads.



"Hit Me with Your Best Shot" is a song written by Eddie Schwartz and recorded by Pat Benatar in 1979, that became a hit in 1980. It is the first single from her 1980 album Crimes of Passion, and it hit #9 on the Billboard Hot 100. The single also sold 1 million copies, reaching gold certification. The song is Pat Benatar's most recognizable song. It can be heard at many soccer games, and is featured on many of Pat Benatar's greatest hits compilations. Pat Benatar herself has said several times that because of the song's excessive popularity, she dislikes performing it live.

Crimes of Passion is the second album by Pat Benatar, released in 1980.

It peaked at #2 on the Billboard 200 and produced the hits "Hit Me with Your Best Shot" (US #9), "You Better Run" (US #42), "Treat Me Right" (US #18), plus a cover of Kate Bush's international hit, "Wuthering Heights".

Hell Is for Children, which was not released as an A-side single, was also a hit on album-rock stations. However, a live version of this song from her Live from Earth album was released as the B-side of her "Love Is a Battlefield" single three years later.
